title: Top 10 Easter Eggs You Missed In The Avengers Infinity War

json.text:
Avengers Infinity War is by far the most anticipated
film of 2018.

It’s been 10 years since the start of the
MCU with Iron Man’s first film, which arguably

marks the start of great superhero films,
with each of their story’s events leading
up to this one film.
It’s a pretty big deal.

And, it’s to be expected that the film is
loaded with Easter Eggs, just like all the
ones prior to it!

So today we’re breaking down those Easter
Eggs and reference for you right here on top
10 nerd.

And of course, THERE ARE SPOILERS IN THIS
VIDEO.
Major spoilers.
Including one about the end of the film.
You’ve been warned!

Before we begin, just wanted to give a big
shoutout to Amino for sponsoring this video!

It’s an app that connects you with a mobile
network of communities in whatever fandoms

or interests you have, letting you mingle
with those who share the same kinds of loves

you do, including all things comic books,
and Marvel!

There’s one for the MCU, one for Marvel/DC
Fans, another for Marvel Legends and even
one for Marvel Roleplay!

So what does being a part of these amino communities
mean?

Well, not only do you get an awesome feed
of content created by other diehard fans like

yourself, but you also can check out polls,
take quizzes, chat with other users and – in

one of my favourite features – check out
what you’ve missed at the biggest conventions,

like Comic Con, Cinema Con or E3, giving you
a window into people’s experiences!

It lets you check things out in real time
with a feature called Live Layer, which ensures

that you’ll never get a bad case of FOMO
when it comes to MCU updates ever again.

And I think we’re all too familiar with
those feels.
So definitely check Amino out today!
Alright!

Now, onto the easter eggs, with our list of
the top 10 Easter Eggs You Missed in Avengers
Infinity War!

And, one last reminder, THERE ARE SO MANY
SPOILERS I AM SO SORRY YOU’VE BEEN WARNED.

10 Vormir
Leading up to the film, there was a whole

lot of speculation about where the Soul Stone
– the last of the infinity stones – was
hiding.

From Wakanda to Titan, there was no shortage
of theories.
Turns out, none of them were right.

The soul stone was actually located on Vormir
– the 6th planet in the Helgentar system

that in the comics, is part of the Kree Empire
and creatures called Vorms – lizard worms,

who have made a few appearances in the comics,
interacting with the likes of Thor.

They don’t appear in the film when Thanos
pays the planet a visit, but someone else
does – Red Skull.

After his death in 1945, he was transported
there – or rather, his spirit was – to
become the guardian of the Soul Stone.
9 Stan Lee!
Of course Stan Lee makes a cameo in the film!
It’s expected!

This time around, Stan appears as a school
bus driver, driving the bus that Peter Parker
and his classmates.

Upon seeing the alien ship in the air, everyone
one the bus freaks out, except Lee, who merely

states “What’s the matter with you, you
never seen a spaceship before?”

8 Arrested Development
The Russo brothers initial claim to fame wasn’t

the Avengers films – rather, it was Arrested
Development.

The duo had directed multiple episodes of
the cult hit, and they even slipped a little

easter egg referencing the show in Captain
America Civil War – the staircase car that
Cap runs on in the airport battle!

This time around, they’ve snuck another
one in.
But this one is much harder to spot.

In a glass case of the Collector’s – a
character whose collections have already given
us a few great Easter Eggs in the past.

This time around, you may notice there is
a blue figurine wearing cut off shorts in

a glass case – this is a reference to arrested
development character Tobias Funke when he
attempts to join the blue man group.

7 Defender
Throughout the film, you may notice that teenage

Groot is carrying around a handheld video
game.

Aside from being the cutest thing ever, turns
out the game that he’s playing has an interesting
and fitting story.

The game is Defender, a 1981 horizontally
scrolling shoot em up arcade game that was
later ported to the Atari 2600 and other consoles.

Turns out Defender has a very similar story
line to that of Infinity War’s – you must

destroy alien invaders, and protect astronauts
from being hurt and abducted.

6 We Have a hulk throwback
Towards the beginning of the film, as the

Asgardian refugee ship makes its way to a
new settlement on Earth, Thanos shows up.

Loki makes a stand against the mad titan,
and utters a line that you’ll all remember

from The Avengers that came from Tony Stark
– “we have a hulk.”

5 Reality Stone throwback
Being adapted from a massive comic franchise,

it makes perfect sense that certain sequences,
actions or behaviours of characters depicted

in the panels would make their way onto the
big screen.

4 Alien Reference
Who doesn’t love a good horrific Alien reference?

When Spider-Man and Iron Man attempt to free
Doctor Strange from Ebony Maw’s control,

there’s a moment where Peter pulls inspiration
from the Alien franchise, and sucks the character

out of a breach in the ship’s hull, tossing
him into outer space and to his death.

Peter also makes another reference later on
in a bit of dialogue when he mentions that

if any aliens appear and try to lay eggs in
his chest, he won’t be having any of that.

3 Thanos & Spider-Man
Speaking of Peter Parker, in another panel

to frame adaptation, Spider-Man takes a shot
at Thanos in the film as he does in the comics.

And what we see on the screen is almost identical
to what happened in the panels.

During the Titan sequence, Peter flings his
web into Thanos’ eye like he does in the
comics.

Thanos also tosses the web slinger down on
the ground in a very similar way that his
illustrated self did.

2 The Snap
One of the most devastating moments in the

comics concerning Thanos is when the character,
once he has assembled all of the Infinity

Gems into the Infinity Gauntlet, snaps his
fingers.

By snapping, he eliminates half of humanity,
causing people to fade away and disappear.
It’s a tremendous and horrific show of power.

And the moment makes it into Infinity War
as one of the final moments of the film, having
dire consequences just as it does in the comics.

But, fear not friends – those of you familiar
with that story arc may know what happens
to reverse those events.

While we don’t get that saving grace moment
in the film, our next number hints that not
all hope is lost.

1 Post Credit Sequence
If all that wasn’t enough for you, the post
credit scene is a bit of a whopper.

While everyone is fading away, Nick Fury aka
Samuel L Jackson makes his last moments count.

He busts out a beeper-looking device and sends
a distress call.

For starts, in classic Samuel L Jackson snakes
on a plane behavior, he shouts out an incomplete
word that rhymes with mother bucker.
So who was he calling?

Well, the screen on his device flashes a logo
of a certain hero we had high hopes of having

a cameo in Infinity War – none other than
Captain Marvel.

It’s safe to say that Avengers 4 will definitely
include Brie Larson’s upcoming character.
There we have it friends!
Did you see any of these coming?
Which Easter Eggs surprised you the most?
Let us know in those comments below!

If you dug this video, please show us some
love by hitting those like and subscribe buttons,
and share it with a friend!
And, don’t forget to check out Amino!

Top 10 Nerd has an account so when you download
it, make sure you link up with us and say
hi!

We’ve also dived pretty deep into the MCU
amino quizzes, so let’s see if you guys
can one up us and beat our high score.

To find out how you can join, check out the
link in our description below for more detail!
Also!

If you’re hungry for more Infinity War,
we’ve got a whole playlist filled with videos

currently flashing on your screen right now
that you should check out!

In the meantime though, thanks for watching
everybody!
I’ll catch you all in the next one!
